009package imagingbook.common.geometry.fd;
010
011import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
012import imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic;
013import imagingbook.common.math.Complex;
014
015/**
016 * <p>
017 * Defines static methods to create Fourier descriptors from uniformly sampled
018 * point sequences. See Ch. 26 of [1] for additional details.
019 * </p>
020 * <p>
021 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An
022 * Algorithmic Introduction Using Java</em>, 2nd ed, Springer (2016).
023 * </p>
024 * 
025 * @author WB
026 * @version 2022/10/24
027 */
028public abstract class FourierDescriptorUniform {
029        
030        private FourierDescriptorUniform() {}
031        
032        /**
033         * Creates a new Fourier descriptor from a uniformly sampled polygon V
034         * with the maximum number of Fourier coefficient pairs.
035         * The length of the resulting DFT spectrum equals V.length.
036         * 
037         * @param V a polygon
038         * @return a new {@link FourierDescriptorUniform} instance
039         */
040        public static FourierDescriptor from(Pnt2d[] V) {
041                return from(FourierDescriptor.toComplexArray(V));
042        }
043        
044        /**
045         * Creates a new Fourier descriptor from a uniformly sampled polygon V
046         * with Mp coefficient pairs.
047         * The length of the resulting DFT spectrum is 2 * mp + 1, i.e.,
048         * it must be assured that Mp &lt; (V.length - 1) &divide; 2.
049         * 
050         * @param V a polygon
051         * @param mp number of coefficient pairs
052         * @return a new {@link FourierDescriptorUniform} instance
053         */
054        public static FourierDescriptor from(Pnt2d[] V, int mp) {
055                return from(FourierDescriptor.toComplexArray(V), mp);
056        }
057        
058        
059        // -------------------------------------------------------------------
060        
061        /**
062         * Creates a new Fourier descriptor from a uniformly sampled polygon V
063         * with the maximum number of Fourier coefficient pairs.
064         * The length of the resulting DFT spectrum equals V.length.
065         * 
066         * @param V a polygon
067         * @return a new {@link FourierDescriptorUniform} instance
068         */
069        public static FourierDescriptor from(Complex[] V) {
070                return new FourierDescriptor(DFT(V));
071        }
072        
073        /**
074         * Creates a new Fourier descriptor from a uniformly sampled polygon V
075         * with Mp coefficient pairs.
076         * The length of the resulting DFT spectrum is 2 * mp + 1, i.e.,
077         * it must be assured that Mp &lt; (V.length - 1) &divide; 2.
078         * 
079         * @param V a sequence of uniformly-spaced 2D sample points
080         * @param mp number of coefficient pairs
081         * @return a new {@link FourierDescriptorUniform} instance
082         */
083        public static FourierDescriptor from(Complex[] V, int mp) {
084                if (mp > (V.length - 1) / 2) {
085                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("number of Fourier pairs (mp) may not be greater than " 
086                                                        + ((V.length - 1) / 2));
087                }
088                return new FourierDescriptor(DFT(V, 2 * mp + 1));
089        }
090        
091        // -------------------------------------------------------------------
092
093        /**
094         * DFT with the resulting spectrum (signal, if inverse) of the same length
095         * as the input vector g. Not using sin/cos tables.
096         * 
097         * @param g signal vector
098         * @return DFT spectrum
099         */
100        private static Complex[] DFT(Complex[] g) {
101                int M = g.length;
102//              double[] cosTable = makeCosTable(M);    // cosTable[m] == cos(2*pi*m/M)
103//              double[] sinTable = makeSinTable(M);    // sinTable[m] == sin(2*pi*m/M)
104                Complex[] G = new Complex[M];
105                double s = 1.0 / M; //common scale factor (fwd/inverse differ!)
106                for (int m = 0; m < M; m++) {
107                        double Am = 0;
108                        double Bm = 0;
109                        for (int k = 0; k < M; k++) {
110                                double x = g[k].re;
111                                double y = g[k].im;
112                                double phi = 2 * Math.PI * m * k / M;
113                                double cosPhi = Math.cos(phi);
114                                double sinPhi = Math.sin(phi);
115                                Am = Am + x * cosPhi + y * sinPhi;
116                                Bm = Bm - x * sinPhi + y * cosPhi;
117                        }
118                        G[m] = new Complex(s * Am, s * Bm);
119                }
120                return G;
121        }
122        
123
124        /**
125         * As {@link #DFT(Complex[])}, with the length of the resulting spectrum
126         * (or signal, if inverse) explicitly specified.
127         * 
128         * @param g  signal vector
129         * @param MM length of the resulting DFT spectrum
130         * @return DFT spectrum
131         */
132        private static Complex[] DFT(Complex[] g, int MM) {
133                int M = g.length;
134                if (MM > M) {
135                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("truncated spectrum must be shorter than original MM = " + MM);
136                }
137//              double[] cosTable = makeCosTable(M);    // cosTable[m] == cos(2*pi*m/M)
138//              double[] sinTable = makeSinTable(M);    // sinTable[m] == sin(2*pi*m/M)
139                Complex[] G = new Complex[MM];
140                double s = 1.0 / M; //common scale factor (fwd/inverse differ!)
141                
142//              for (int j = Mp/2-Mp+1; j <= Mp/2; j++) {
143                for (int j = -MM/2; j <= (MM-1)/2; j++) {
144                        double Am = 0;
145                        double Bm = 0;
146                        for (int k = 0; k < M; k++) {
147                                double x = g[k].re;
148                                double y = g[k].im;
149                                //int mk = (m * k) % M; double phi = 2 * Math.PI * mk / M;
150                                double phi = 2 * Math.PI * j * k / M;   
151                                double cosPhi = Math.cos(phi);
152                                double sinPhi = Math.sin(phi);
153                                Am = Am + x * cosPhi + y * sinPhi;
154                                Bm = Bm - x * sinPhi + y * cosPhi;
155                        }
156                        G[Arithmetic.mod(j, MM)] = new Complex(s * Am, s * Bm);
157                }
158                return G;
159        }
160
161//      private double[] makeCosTable(int M) {
162//              double[] cosTab = new double[M];
163//              for (int m = 0; m < M; m++) {
164//                      cosTab[m] = Math.cos(2 * Math.PI * m / M);
165//              }
166//              return cosTab;
167//      }
168
169//      private double[] makeSinTable(int M) {
170//              double[] sinTab = new double[M];
171//              for (int m = 0; m < M; m++) {
172//                      sinTab[m] = Math.sin(2 * Math.PI * m / M);
173//              }
174//              return sinTab;
175//      }
176        
177}
